We see a very great work to be done in the world and we cannot endure the thought of failing in physical strength now. I look all over the field 


                                   -304- 

and I see none who could fill your father's place. His head to plan and his life of experience to balance the inexperienced is very essential. God has a work for us to do and we need the help, the encouragement and confidence of our people to do this work.--Letter 41, 1876, pp. 1, 2. (To Edson and Emma White, August 24, 1876.)
